intro: Test your knowledge of this week's Herald news!

questions.question: What was the score of the women’s soccer game against Harvard last Saturday?
questions.explanation: On Saturday night, the women’s soccer team (8-2-4, 2-1-2 Ivy) tied Ivy League leader Harvard (5-4-3, 3-1-1 Ivy) 2-2 following a heated matchup in Cambridge. Entering the weekend, Brown had the chance to claim the No. 1 spot in the Ivy League, but following the draw, they fell to fourth.

questions.question: Which artist’s work is featured in a new exhibit at the Watson School for International and Public Affairs?
questions.explanation: On Sept. 24, Art at Watson unveiled their most recent installation: “In the Name of FREƎDOM” by Azadeh Ghotbi ’91. The installation will be on display until Dec. 15 in Stephen Robert ’62 Hall.

questions.question: Approximately how many Rhode Island residents’ personal info was compromised in the Brightstar Lottery Group data breach?
questions.explanation: Earlier this month, Brightstar Lottery Group notified the Rhode Island Attorney General’s Office and impacted individuals about a data breach that compromised the personal information of over 6,000 R.I. residents. The company is the state’s exclusive lottery supplier through 2043.

questions.question: How much total money did Delaney O’Dea ’28 win on “Jeopardy!”?
questions.explanation: O’Dea placed first on the quiz show’s Oct. 15 episode before returning for a second place finish on Thursday night. Between her two appearances, she earned a total prize of $21,600, clinching a spot as one of the show’s youngest champions.

questions.question: Which organization does the course FREN 1410T: “L’expérience des réfugiés: déplacements, migrations” partner with?
choices: Rhode Island Commission for Human Rights
Dorcas International Institute of Rhode Island
questions.explanation: Designed for students who have advanced proficiency in French, the course partners with Women’s Refugee Care, a Providence-based organization founded by Clement Shabani and Aline Binyungu, both French-speaking refugees from the Democratic Republic of the Congo.

questions.question: What percent of students say they call their parents at least once a week?
questions.explanation: According to recent poll data, more than 81 percent of students reported calling their parents at least once per week.

questions.question: Peter Howitt is Brown’s ______ Nobel laureate.
questions.explanation: Howitt’s research, which he conducted alongside co-laureate Philipe Aghion, a French microeconomist, explores the relationship between technological innovation and the economy. With this award, Howitt became Brown’s third Nobel laureate.

questions.question: Which renowned filmmaker gave a talk at Brown this weekend in partnership with Brown 2026, a campus-wide initiative celebrating the 250th anniversary of American independence?
questions.explanation: On Friday, cinephiles, historians and Family Weekend attendees alike gathered for “An Evening with Ken Burns,” in the Salomon Center. In partnership with Brown 2026 — a campus-wide initiative celebrating the 250th anniversary of American independence — the event featured an exclusive screening of Burns’s upcoming documentary series.

questions.question: In what decade did the Providence Public School District start offering bilingual education programs?
questions.explanation: Since the 1970s, the Providence Public School district has offered bilingual education programs to students across the district. Though the benefits of the program are clear, capacity is limited.

questions.question: How many attendees were at Providence’s “No Kings” rally on Saturday?
questions.explanation: Sponsored by the R.I. Resistance Coalition and other community groups, Providence’s protest saw a turnout of 32,000, according to organizers.
